definition: to strike while the iron is hot
old variant of 趁[chen4]
to avail oneself of/to take advantage of
to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
dozen (loanword)
iron (metal)/arms/weapons/hard/strong/violent/unshakeable/determined/close/tight (slang)
surname Tie

sentences.english: Motivation comes in short bursts. Act while it's hot.
sentences.chinese: 激励是以急促爆发的方式到来的，要趁热打铁。

sentences.english: Your suggestion, to strike while the iron is hot, seemed a good idea.
sentences.chinese: 你建议趁热打铁，这个建议很好。

sentences.english: The Spaniard then focussed on the task at hand, and hoped that the winning mentality would continue against Villa.
sentences.chinese: 贝尼特斯还希望他们能趁热打铁再拿下阿斯顿维拉。

sentences.english: Container market is carried also strike while iron is hot, lively and extraordinary.
sentences.chinese: 集装箱市场运输也趁热打铁，热闹非凡。

sentences.english: We must strike while the iron is hot.
The best time to conduct a customer satisfaction survey is when the experience is fresh in their minds.
sentences.chinese: 进行客户满意调查的最佳时间是趁热打铁。

sentences.english: Now is the time to strike. The iron could not be hotter.
sentences.chinese: 目前乃趁热打铁之最佳时机。

sentences.english: We should strike while the iron is hot.

definition: to follow up a victory and press home the attack/to pursue retreating enemy
lit. to push the boat with the current/fig. to take advantage of the situation for one's own benefit
to continue the struggle (idiom); to persist/unremitting efforts
exactly what one wants
in a spurt of energy
to seize the opportune moment/to lose no time
to boost support or interest/to campaign/to promote
strike first and gain the upper hand (idiom, martial arts term); Making the first move is an advantage.
to quit while one is ahead (idiom)/to know when to stop
to be eager to give sth a try (idiom)
to make a firm resolution
to win instant success (idiom)/to start off successfully
a move/an action/in one move/at a stroke/in one go
the matter should not be delayed/there's no time to lose
eager to/in a hurry to
to plan/to intend/to calculate/plan/intention/calculation/CL:個|个[ge4]
